items.title: Unable to setup fancycompleter 0.9.0 for Python 2.7 with LANG=C
items.body:
I came across this issue when tried to set this up on my local development environment. The issue can be reproduced with a Docker python2.7

```bash
docker run --rm -i -t -e LANG=C python:2.7 pip install fancycompleter
```

```
DEPRECATION: Python 2.7 reached the end of its life on January 1st, 2020. Please upgrade your Python as Python 2.7 is no longer maintained. A future version of pip will drop support for Python 2.7. More details about Python 2 support in pip, can be found at https://pip.pypa.io/en/latest/development/release-process/#python-2-support
Collecting fancycompleter
  Downloading fancycompleter-0.9.0.tar.gz (10 kB)
    ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 1:
     command: /usr/local/bin/python -c 'import sys, setuptools, tokenize; sys.argv[0] = '"'"'/tmp/pip-install-zu5MqZ/fancycompleter/setup.py'"'"'; __file__='"'"'/tmp/pip-install-zu5MqZ/fancycompleter/setup.py'"'"';f=getattr(tokenize, '"'"'open'"'"', open)(__file__);code=f.read().replace('"'"'\r\n'"'"', '"'"'\n'"'"');f.close();exec(compile(code, __file__, '"'"'exec'"'"'))' egg_info --egg-base /tmp/pip-install-zu5MqZ/fancycompleter/pip-egg-info
         cwd: /tmp/pip-install-zu5MqZ/fancycompleter/
    Complete output (20 lines):
    DEPRECATION: Python 2.7 reached the end of its life on January 1st, 2020. Please upgrade your Python as Python 2.7 is no longer maintained. A future version of pip will drop support for Python 2.7. More details about Python 2 support in pip, can be found at https://pip.pypa.io/en/latest/development/release-process/#python-2-support
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
      File "/tmp/pip-install-zu5MqZ/fancycompleter/setup.py", line 32, in <module>
        "pyreadline;platform_system=='Windows'",
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools/__init__.py", line 145, in setup
        return distutils.core.setup(**attrs)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/distutils/core.py", line 137, in setup
        ok = dist.parse_command_line()
      File "/tmp/pip-install-zu5MqZ/fancycompleter/.eggs/setupmeta-2.6.18-py2.7.egg/setupmeta/hook.py", line 23, in distutils_hook
        dist._setupmeta = SetupMeta(dist)
      File "/tmp/pip-install-zu5MqZ/fancycompleter/.eggs/setupmeta-2.6.18-py2.7.egg/setupmeta/model.py", line 626, in __init__
        self.pkg_info = PackageInfo(MetaDefs.project_dir)
      File "/tmp/pip-install-zu5MqZ/fancycompleter/.eggs/setupmeta-2.6.18-py2.7.egg/setupmeta/model.py", line 403, in __init__
        lines = load_contents(self.path)
      File "/tmp/pip-install-zu5MqZ/fancycompleter/.eggs/setupmeta-2.6.18-py2.7.egg/setupmeta/content.py", line 29, in load_contents
        for line in fh:
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/encodings/ascii.py", line 26, in decode
        return codecs.ascii_decode(input, self.errors)[0]
    UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe2 in position 3592: ordinal not in range(128)
    ----------------------------------------
ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 1: python setup.py egg_info Check the logs for full command output.
```

I dug a bit deeper, and I believe that the issue is that README.md, which is included in the egg package, has a non-ASCII `just work™` clause. Is there any chance you can remove this symbol and re-upload a new patch version of the package?

Thanks!

items.title: New release to PyPI?
items.body: It looks like the last PyPI release was 0.8 (Oct. 25, 2017).

items.title: Make use of upstream attr_matches
items.body:
This supports e.g. omitting private members initially: https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/530f506ac91338b55cf2be71b1cdf50cb077512f/Lib/rlcompleter.py#L161-L166

Since https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/ab824222d1356ce731f18e9d585d58d84a64637d

(I had added this in pdbpp itself manually on top in https://github.com/pdbpp/pdbpp/commit/6f79a43)

items.title: Should handle missing "Config" in config file silently/better
items.body:
With pdb++ and empty `~/.pdbrc.py` it will display:

> ** error when importing ~/.pdbrc.py: 'Config' **

(via https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/5345)

Related code: https://github.com/pdbpp/fancycompleter/blob/35e892813fa0b5d071bb6dcc6d960bcdc14bb75e/fancycompleter.py#L200-L206
